Name: LU 869 - Zoning, Gowanus Neighborhood Plan, Brooklyn (C 210177 ZMK)
Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 210177 ZMK, a Zoning Map amendment (L.U. No. 869).

History.Action: Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

  By Council Members Salamanca and Moya 0\par

\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x720	ab WHEREAS, the New York City Department of City Planning (DCP),\expndtw-6  filed an application \expndtw0 pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section Nos. 16c and 16d, by eliminating from within an existing R8A District, eliminating a Special Enhanced Commercial District (EC-1), changing from an R6B District to an R6A District, changing from an R6 District to an R6B District, changing from an R8A District to a C4-4D District, changing from an C8-2 District to a C4-4D District, changing from an M1-2 District to a C4-4D District, changing from an C8-2 District to an M1-4 District, changing from an M1-1 District to an M1-4 District, changing from an M1-2 District to an M1-4 District, changing from an M2-1 District to an M1-4 District, changing from an M3-1 District to an M1-4 District, changing from an R6 District to an M1-4/R6A District, changing from an M1-1 District to an M1-4/R6A District, changing from an M1-2 District to a M1-4/R6A District, changing from an M2-1 District to an M1-4/R6A District, changing from an C8-2 District to an M1-4/R6B District, changing from an M1-1 District to an M1-4/R6B District, changing from an M1-2 District to an M1-4/R6B District, changing from an M2-1 District to an M1-4/R6B District, changing from an M2-1 District to an M1-4/R7-2 District, changing from an M3-1 District to an M1-4/R7-2 District, changing from an M1-2 District to an M1-4/R7A District, changing from an R6 District to an M1-4/R7X District, \cf1 changing\cf0  from an C8-2 District to an M1-4/R7X District, changing from an M1-2 District to an M1-4/R7X District, changing from an M2-1 District to an M1-4/R7X District, and establishing a Special Gowanus Mixed Use District (G), which in conjunction with the related action to facilitate land use changes for 82 full or partial blocks associated with the Gowanus Neighborhood Plan, Community Districts 2 and 6, (ULURP No. C 210177 ZMK) (the "Application");\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i720\qj\par
WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on October 22, 2021 its decision dated October 20, 2021 (the "Decision") on the Application; \par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x720	x1440	x2160	qr	x9360\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	ab WHEREAS, the Application is related to applications N 210178 ZRK (L.U. No. 870), a zoning text amendment to establish the Special Gowanus Mixed-Use District, Gowanus Waterfront Access Plan, establish a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing (MIH) area, and replace the EC-1 within the rezoning area; C 210179 MMK (L.U. No. 871), a the establishment of streets, the elimination of street segments, and removal of a \ldblquote Public Placedblquote  designation; C 210180 MMK (L.U. No. 872), a city map amendment involving the mapping of parkland; C 210053 PPK (L.U. No. 873), a disposition of City-owned property; and C 210052 HAK (L.U. No. 874), a disposition approval, UDAA and UDAAP designation;\par
\pard\ltrpar i180\li-180\qj 1 s22\par
\pard\ltrpar\qj	x720 0 s24\par
 \par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i720\qj WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i720\qj WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on October 12, 2021;\par
\par
WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	ab\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x720	ab WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the Positive Declaration issued March 22\super nd
osupersub , 2019 (CEQR No. 19DCP157K) and a Final Environmental Impact Statement (FEIS) for which a Notice of Completion was issued on September 10, 2021, which identified significant adverse impacts related to hazardous materials, air quality, and noise, which would be avoided through the placement of (E) designations (E-601) on selected projected and potential development sites; and significant adverse impacts with respect to community facilities (publicly funded child care services), active open space, shadows (Douglass & Degraw Pool and Our Lady of Peace stained glass windows), historic and cultural resources (architectural and archaeological), transportation (traffic, transit, and pedestrians), air quality (mobile source), and construction activities related to noise and historic and cultural resources; and the proposed mitigation measures summarized in Chapter 21, Mitigation, of the FEIS, and the Technical Memoranda dated September 21, 2021 and November 16, 2021 (the \ldblquote Technical Memorandadblquote ).\par
\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x0	x864	x2016	x3168	x4320	x5472	x6624	x7776	x8928 RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\qj	x0	x720	x864	x2016	x3168	x4320	x5472	x6624	x7776	x8928 2	ab 0 Having considered the FEIS and Technical Memoranda with respect to the Decision and Application, the Council finds that:\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i-720\li720\qj	x720  	ab\par
(1)	ab The FEIS meets the requirements of 6 N.Y.C.R.R. Part 617; \par
\par
(2)	ab The environmental impacts disclosed in the FEIS were evaluated in relation to the social, economic, and other considerations associated with the actions that are set forth in this report; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\li720\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i-720\li720\qj	x720 (3)	ab Consistent with social, economic and other essential considerations from among the reasonable alternatives available, the action is one which avoids or minimizes adverse environmental impacts to the maximum extent practicable; 3	ab\par
\pard\ltrpar\li720\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x720 2	ab 0 The Decision, together with the FEIS and Technical Memoranda constitute the written statement of facts, and of social, economic and other factors and standards that form the basis of this determination, pursuant to 6 N.Y.C.R.R. 'a7617.11(d).\par
\pard\ltrpar\li720\qj	x720 2\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i720\qj 0 Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 201 of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 210177 ZMK, incorporated by reference herein, and the record before the Council, the Council approves the Decision of the City Planning Commission.\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar
